title: Calories in Crab Legs
meta_description: Discover calories in crab legs per 100 g of meat, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Cooked (steamed or boiled) Alaska king crab legs, meat only (shell removed), no added butter or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by crab species, cooking method, portion of meat extracted, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked crab leg meat provides ~83 kcal and ~18 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Dipped in 1 tsp melted butter per 100 g
Breaded and fried (adds ~50 kcal per 100 g)
Snow crab instead of king crab (slightly lower protein)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of crab legs?
faqs.a: About 83 kcal for cooked king crab leg meat.

faqs.q: Is crab leg meat high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~18 g protein per 100 g, with low fat and carbs.
Negligible carbs (0 g per 100 g) and no fiber or sugars.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in crab legs?
faqs.a: Natural seawater content; ~563 mg per 100 g, even without added salt.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in crab legs?
faqs.a: Minimal change; steaming/boiling keeps calories low compared to frying.
